channel.title: Heaps :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Heaps A common structure for implementing a priority queue is known as a heap. A heap is a tree whose nodes contain elements with priorities that can be ordered. Furthermore, if the heap is nonempty, its root contains the maximum priority of any node in the heap, and each of its children is also a heap. Note that this implies that, in any subtree, the maximum priority is at the root.
